criteria: Understanding fractions as numbers on a number line
Locating the number a/b on the number line
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of how to represent fractions on a number line.
Student can represent simple fractions (e.g., 1/2, 1/4) on a number line but struggles with more complex fractions.
Student can represent fractions with smaller denominators on a number line but has difficulty with larger denominators or non-unit fractions.
Student can accurately represent most fractions on a number line, including unit and non-unit fractions, but may make occasional errors in placement.
Student can accurately represent fractions on a number line and explain the relationship between the numerator, denominator, and position on the number line.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of fractions on a number line, accurately represents complex fractions, and can explain the concept clearly and precisely.
Student does not attempt to mark off lengths or shows no understanding of the concept.
Student attempts to mark off lengths but does so inaccurately or inconsistently.
Student can mark off lengths for simple fractions but struggles with more complex fractions or larger denominators.
Student can accurately mark off lengths for most fractions but may make occasional errors in spacing or labeling.
Student consistently and accurately marks off lengths for fractions, demonstrating a clear understanding of the unit fraction's role.
Student demonstrates expertise in marking off lengths, applies the concept to various fractions, and explains the process effectively.
Student does not recognize or identify the interval size.
Student attempts to identify the interval size but struggles to do so accurately.
Student can identify the interval size for simple fractions but struggles with more complex fractions or larger denominators.
Student can accurately identify the interval size for most fractions but may make occasional errors in calculations or labeling.
Student consistently and accurately identifies the interval size, demonstrating a clear understanding of its relationship to the fraction.
Student demonstrates a deep understanding of interval size, applies the concept to various fractions, and explains the connection effectively.
Student cannot locate the number on the number line.
Student attempts to locate the number but does so inaccurately or inconsistently.
Student can locate simple fractions but struggles with more complex fractions or larger denominators.
Student can accurately locate most fractions but may make occasional errors in placement or labeling.
Student consistently and accurately locates fractions on the number line, demonstrating a clear understanding of their position.
Student demonstrates expertise in locating fractions on the number line, applies the concept to various fractions, and explains the position effectively.
